qas.question: What is another name for the Shamsi Hijri calender?

What is the customary calendar of Iran?
How many months are in the Shamsi Hijri calendar?

What prophets year of birth marks the first year of the calander?

context: <a0_0><b6_0>The Solar Hijri calendar<b6_0/><a0_0/>, also called <a2_0>the <b5_0><b7_0>Shamsi Hijri calendar<b7_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>, and abbreviated as <a1_0>SH<a1_0/>, is the official calendar of Iran and Afghanistan. It begins on the vernal equinox. Each of the <a3_0>twelve months<a3_0/> corresponds with a zodiac sign. The first six months have 31 days, the next five have 30 days, and the last month has 29 days in usual years but 30 days in leap years. The year of <a4_0>Prophet <b9_0>Muhammad<b9_0/>'s migration to Medina<a4_0/> (622 CE) is fixed as the first year of the calendar, and the New Year's Day always falls on the <b8_0>March equinox<b8_0/>.
